intro: Justicia acanthifolia, commonly known as the spiked flameflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its showy inflorescences attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees, making it a valuable addition to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water once established.
